summary: Can someone please write me a fic where reader has an abusive? mum and the character notices and does something to help/defend...
body:
Can someone please write me a fic where reader has an abusive? mum and the character notices and does something to help/defend the reader?

Mother does stuff like snap and get disproportionately angry at little things. Bit of a victim complex/narcissistic. Can absolutely explode in anger, screaming and swearing, gets in readers face with bit of a shove here or there. Then is totally normal the next second. Walk on eggshells type of childhood (dad is around and is treated similar to reader). Reader is Smacked a lot/unnecessarily as a child. Any kind of speaking in defense or explanation in a disagreement is met with yelling/screaming/aggression. Micro-aggression? Like needling comment, veiled insults/criticism of reader.

Reader is older (early 20s) but studies and so pays cheaper rent to live at home. But reader doesn’t cower or become timid. Defs has some issues (trust. Fear of failure/rejection. Can be jumpy but not fearful) but doesn’t back down from the mother and when it’s the ‘lesser’ stuff barely even reacts at all. Which is sad cuz she’s so used to it.

I’ve had some shit go down and it would really help to have a fic with someone who helps, defends or saves the reader.

Loki. Natasha Romanoff. Bucky. Dean W. Anakin. Obi Wan. Steve Rogers. Would all be good options. If you can write this, please DM me or tag me in the fic so I know. I would really, really appreciate it. I need something like this rn.

summary: My Heart Belongs To The Devil (6)
title: My Heart Belongs To The Devil (6)
body:
Summary: You spend your long life, hiding from people, avoiding everyone at all costs, and building walls around yourself. You’re fine with it, until one day, the ugly truth is revealed, but is it as bad as it seems?

Pairing: Bucky x demon!reader

A/N: HELLLO I KNOW I SAID I WOULDNT POST FOR A WHILE BUT I MANAGED TO FIT THIS IN! SO YEAH HERE YA GO!

Warnings: UHM ANGST SADNESS SOME BUCKY X READER ACTION YA KNOW.

Word Count: 2258

Your feet shuffled silently against the clean and shiny marble flooring. As you neared your location, three knocks on the door and a ‘Gimme a second!’ was heard from the other side. As you held your breath, he ran to the door, opening it with a full swing. He looked, dead, really. Messy and ruffled hair, red eyes, terribly dark circles and big under-eye bags. You could smell that he wasn’t in his right state and that a wave of depression had hit him. Was it something I did? 

“Oh. Y/N, uh, hello.” he muttered as his eyes averted from yours. 

“Bucky, cut the crap, we need to talk.” you stated through clenched teeth as you pulled him into his room.

His room was even more messy too. Clothes sprawled all over the floor, blankets turned inside out and crumpled into some indescribable shape. Broken glass in some corner, pages of a diary ripped out of its leather cover. Cigarette butts by the window and dents in the walls in multiple places.

“Uh-” Bucky tried to talk but you cut him right off.

“Look, I’m the devil here, I’m gonna do the talking. To put it simply, it’s feeding season. Nat probably already explained it. Anyways, that night, you saw me feeding, I need it to live. I’m sorry if I caused any negative thoughts and terrible ideas that formed in your head, but I need you to let the Avengers know something. Although I’m supposedly a member, I won’t be sticking around often, especially within the next month or two. Don’t expect anything of me, I’ll come and help if it’s a dire situation, but besides that, I’m gone. If you want, I can erase the scene from that night from your memor-”

“Wait you can do that?” Bucky asked in enthusiasm. You knew that he was referring to his Hydra past and his Winter Soldier days.

“Yes Bucky I can. But it could be hard for you because I haven’t been around for quite a bit of your past.” You said with a broken heart. You knew that he didn’t want to be associated with Hydra or Winter Soldier whatsoever, but you couldn’t help but tell him the truth. A part of him shattered, but you promised yourself to show him something beautiful someday.

“I think I’ll stay with the memory” you were shocked to say the least.

“I don’t know how I feel about it, but just don’t erase it. I think I wanna keep it.” Bucky stated. You nodded, respecting his choice and reminded him to tell the others of your decision before teleporting away to some place in who knows where. He only blinked rapidly, trying to process what happened in front of him.

“She’s what? We hire her and have a whole celebration and after one damn incident she says she won’t be here for the next month or two? How could you let her slip away like that?” Tony asked Bucky as Bucky held his head in his hands.

“Are you serious Tony? You’re telling me I’m to try and stop the devil from doing whatever she wants? The girl told me to deliver a message, so I did. Plus, she did the whole zapping thing.” Bucky explained quietly. From far away, you were listening to their conversation. He actually listened to me. Shocker. 

“Anyways point is, let Y/N do her own thing, let her figure out whatever she has to figure out until she can come back to us.” Steve asked.

I remember the beginning. Watching the world form, almost from nothing. Just, into matter. Back then, I was nothing as well. Just a void being, with no proper form or matter, observing things. I had an idea of who, or what I was. The one thing that people throughout thousands, millions of generations would learn to fear and not mess with. The timeless entity that proved to be the worst of the worst. When man was created, I remember being a snake, no motive to cause harm of course, but it just happens. I guess every where I go, chaos follows. Throughout the Aztecs developing a following lead me to start dabbling in the art of human like forms. That’s when my classic form was decided. Black horns that could spiral out of my head, fangs sharp to cut through anything, my whole eye turning black with black wings that stretched out of my back. Depending on my feeling they were either fluffy, full, voluptuous with many feathers, or bare, bat like, with claws at the end of them.

I never knew who it was, but someone was always there to tell me “Trust nobody and you’ll deal with nobody, trust anybody and you’ll have to deal with anybody.’. Maybe it was my mother? Or a parental figure who just so happened to refresh every time the previous one passed away. I recall my first love: Huitzilin, the local farmer boy at an Aztec village. He had seen my demon like form before and didn’t fear me, or at least from what I could tell. Maybe he even found it beautiful, but that’s long gone now. Over the years, growing a crust on my heart was something I had grown accustomed to. No feelings, no love, no friends. I couldn’t deal with it, and I wasn’t planning on doing so any time soon. Then came Will. I was foolish, I didn’t care that he saw me feeding in the back alleyway on some random man, I didn’t care that he stared at me in awe with my natural form. I was so convinced that he understood that I couldn’t be with him forever but obviously that didn’t work. What was I supposed to do? Marry a man who would die in maybe 70 years and live on with that pain in my chest? No can do, when you’re supposedly eternal.

And now, there’s the Avengers. Tony Stark, so egotistical, thinks that he knows what’s best for me. Steve is a good man, all for justice, but I can smell the fear radiating off of him when I’m around. Bruce, he’s different. Of course he’s scared, but a part of him understands how I feel about myself. Sam is terrified and it’s obvious but I could care less about him. Natasha and Wanda, they seem chill, and understandably they’d like me there as another addition to the small amount of girls, but I can’t risk that feeling. It would crush me.

The pen clicked as you closed your journal, writing your latest entry. As you sighed, the urge for human flesh only grew stronger. Groaning at yourself, you threw on a leather jacket over your black sweatpants and grey crop top and slipping on some vans you made your way down to the local bar to pick up some random girl. Admittedly, they tasted better than men. Pushing open the door, the familiar scent of intoxication and sex filled your nostrils. Yet, another familiar scent. Bucky’s scent. It was only 5 pm, and Nat wasn’t here either. Walking over to him, you grabbed a seat, temporarily hiding your needs.

“What brings you here at only 5?” You whispered, causing him to jump in his seat, making some whiskey spill over his glass in the process.

“Jesus. I’m just drownin my sorrows as always.” Bucky claimed, but you knew it was a lie. He was heartbroken, it was as obvious as the dark circles under his eyes.

“Who was she?” you asked, not caring about invading his personal space.

“Sally, she was gorgeous. Always saw the light in me, helped me through nightmares and anxiety attacks, always calmed me down and went through everything with me. I saw her sucking some guy off this morning, I threw a fit and ended up here.” Bucky murmured, chugging down the remainder of his drink and signalling the bartender to fill it up again. Your expression softened upon understanding the situation, yet it brightened up after a thought came into your head.

“I can help, if you want of course.” You stated simply, searching his eyes for an answer. He slowly but surely lifted his head to match your gaze, and for once had hope in his eyes.

“You can erase her from my memories? Like, as if I’d never know she existed?” Bucky inquired with a hopeful look in his eyes. You smiled and nodded in response and waited for his answer.

“I’m not sure how I feel about that yet, I’ll let you know if I ever feel like it. Thanks.” Bucky stated as his head dropped back down to the table. But hey, the offer was still up. You sighed, making your way to the ladies bathroom, picking up some random, intoxicated woman to feed off of, and began the process. Halfway through feeding, your ears picked up on Bucky saying your name.

Yeah she’s here, but I don’t think you should come here Tony. You heard her plan, and you barging in probably won’t help. Just let the woman live her life until she’s ready to come back.

Are you kidding me! Barnes I know where you are and I’m going there now. You better keep an eye on Xia!

Uh a bit late for that. Last time I saw she went upstairs to the bathroom I think? But I have no clue where she is.

THEN FIND HER!

You cringed at the thought of Tony coming to the bar, so you finished wiping off the blood from your lips, locking yourself in a stall whilst waiting for your eyes and wings to return to normal. 

Xia? Xia?

A voice called out. You focused on it, recognising that Bucky was still in his spot by the bar.

I don’t know if you can hear me, but Tony’s coming here. If you want to stay, then stay, but I can’t promise what’s going to happen. I’d say watch out.

His voice seemed soft, with concern and worry in his tone. There was caution, and you were surprised he talked like that. The fact that he talked to you, the devil, as if he had known you for a while. You smiled at his sincerity.

Thank you, James.

You felt his eyes open in shock and heart beat increase at the sound of your voice. You giggled and slowly made your way downstairs, your eyes meeting with his. God they’re beautiful. As if the sea were trapped in them. 

“Oh you’re still here?” Bucky asked in slight shock. Nodding in response, you both heard Tony text Bucky saying he was only 5 minutes away.

“You don’t have to see Tony if you don’t want to you know.” Bucky warned.

“Thank you, but I’m ok. I already said that I wouldn’t be going back for 2-3 months, and he didn’t listen. He’s gonna get it now.” You stated nonchalantly.

“What do you mean?”Bucky questioned.

“Ha, well. It is feeding season, so I stay away from you all for a reason. But if Tony so desperately wants me to stay, he’s gonna have to deal with it. So, I’m just gonna give him an example of what usually happens.” You purred, eyes darkening at the thought of scaring Tony.

“Are you saying you’re gonna feed on people, at the tower, or even one of us?” Bucky inquired, with fear practically radiating off of him.

“Good God now, I’ll just have all my meals in Tony’s room, because why not! Plus, I might steal a secretary of his or two.” You chuckled. Bucky quietly laughed at you saying you would eat in Tony’s room, but you could still smell the fear in him.

“I promise, no harm will be brung to any of the Avengers. I’ll avoid all of you, it’s just Tony. He doesn’t listen, so if he wants me to be there so bad, he’ll have to put up with me.” you claimed. As the roar of a somewhat expensive car was heard in front of the bar, you put on a show!

“Now, come on Xia. We hold you a ball, you’re part of the Avengers and you run off like that?” Tony asked as he tried to hug you but you swerve out the way, causing him to pull back awkwardly.

“If I’m not mistaken, which I know I’m not, Bucky gave my message to you. If you want me to be with you all so badly, you’ll have to deal with me. This is your last chance to listen to me, because if you don’t, sure I’ll go back to the tower with you, but you won’t be happy with me.” You claimed, as Tony tilted his head in confusion.

“I’m not happy with any of the weirdos at the tower, you won’t be the first.” Tony said with a smug smirk.

“Fine. But don’t complain when the walls are covered with blood.” You whispered, so only he could hear.

“I’m sorry, what?” Tony asked, shock and worry in his voice.

“Jeez, chill out old man! I won’t harm any of the Avengers, I have nothing against you all. You worry too much.” You laughed as you punched his arm, taking a mental note to tone it down as he clenched his forearm in pain.

“Right, right. Noted.” Tony mentioned as he directed you and Bucky to walk outside to the car.

“But really, prepare to have cleaning ladies deal with lots of blood.” You mentioned with a straight face.


(A/N THIS WAS HIS FACE AHAHAHAH)

Your expression softened upon understanding the situation, yet it brightened up after a thought came into your head.

“I can help, if you want of course.” You stated simply, searching his eyes for an answer. He slowly but surely lifted his head to match your gaze, and for once had hope in his eyes.

“You can erase her from my memories? Like, as if I’d never know she existed?” Bucky inquired with a hopeful look in his eyes. You smiled and nodded in response and waited for his answer.

“I’m not sure how I feel about that yet, I’ll let you know if I ever feel like it. Thanks.” Bucky stated as his head dropped back down to the table. But hey, the offer was still up. You sighed, making your way to the ladies bathroom, picking up some random, intoxicated woman to feed off of, and began the process. Halfway through feeding, your ears picked up on Bucky saying your name.

Yeah she’s here, but I don’t think you should come here Tony. You heard her plan, and you barging in probably won’t help. Just let the woman live her life until she’s ready to come back.

Are you kidding me! Barnes I know where you are and I’m going there now. You better keep an eye on Xia!

Uh a bit late for that. Last time I saw she went upstairs to the bathroom I think? But I have no clue where she is.

THEN FIND HER!

Xia? Xia?

I don’t know if you can hear me, but Tony’s coming here. If you want to stay, then stay, but I can’t promise what’s going to happen. I’d say watch out.

His voice seemed soft, with concern and worry in his tone. There was caution, and you were surprised he talked like that. The fact that he talked to you, the devil, as if he had known you for a while. You smiled at his sincerity.

Thank you, James.

“You don’t have to see Tony if you don’t want to you know.” Bucky warned.

“What do you mean?”Bucky questioned.

“Ha, well. It is feeding season, so I stay away from you all for a reason. But if Tony so desperately wants me to stay, he’s gonna have to deal with it. So, I’m just gonna give him an example of what usually happens.” You purred, eyes darkening at the thought of scaring Tony.

“Are you saying you’re gonna feed on people, at the tower, or even one of us?” Bucky inquired, with fear practically radiating off of him.

“Good God now, I’ll just have all my meals in Tony’s room, because why not! Plus, I might steal a secretary of his or two.” You chuckled. Bucky quietly laughed at you saying you would eat in Tony’s room, but you could still smell the fear in him.

“I promise, no harm will be brung to any of the Avengers. I’ll avoid all of you, it’s just Tony. He doesn’t listen, so if he wants me to be there so bad, he’ll have to put up with me.” you claimed. As the roar of a somewhat expensive car was heard in front of the bar, you put on a show!

“Now, come on Xia. We hold you a ball, you’re part of the Avengers and you run off like that?” Tony asked as he tried to hug you but you swerve out the way, causing him to pull back awkwardly.

“If I’m not mistaken, which I know I’m not, Bucky gave my message to you. If you want me to be with you all so badly, you’ll have to deal with me. This is your last chance to listen to me, because if you don’t, sure I’ll go back to the tower with you, but you won’t be happy with me.” You claimed, as Tony tilted his head in confusion.

“I’m not happy with any of the weirdos at the tower, you won’t be the first.” Tony said with a smug smirk.

“Fine. But don’t complain when the walls are covered with blood.” You whispered, so only he could hear.

“I’m sorry, what?” Tony asked, shock and worry in his voice.

“Jeez, chill out old man! I won’t harm any of the Avengers, I have nothing against you all. You worry too much.” You laughed as you punched his arm, taking a mental note to tone it down as he clenched his forearm in pain.

“Right, right. Noted.” Tony mentioned as he directed you and Bucky to walk outside to the car.

“But really, prepare to have cleaning ladies deal with lots of blood.” You mentioned with a straight face.

I had an idea of who, or what I was. The one thing that people throughout thousands, millions of generations would learn to fear and not mess with. The timeless entity that proved to be the worst of the worst. When man was created, I remember being a snake, no motive to cause harm of course, but it just happens. Black horns that could spiral out of my head, fangs sharp to cut through anything, my whole eye turning black with black wings that stretched out of my back. Of course he’s scared, but a part of him understands how I feel about myself. Sam is terrified and it’s obvious but I could care less about him. Natasha and Wanda, they seem chill, and understandably they’d like me there as another addition to the small amount of girls, but I can’t risk that feeling. It would crush me.

Your feet shuffled silently against the clean and shiny marble flooring. As you neared your location, three knocks on the door and a ‘Gimme a second!’ was heard from the other side. As you held your breath, he ran to the door, opening it with a full swing. He looked, dead, really. Messy and ruffled hair, red eyes, terribly dark circles and big under-eye bags. You could smell that he wasn’t in his right state and that a wave of depression had hit him. Was it something I did? 

“Oh. Y/N, uh, hello.” he muttered as his eyes averted from yours. 

“Bucky, cut the crap, we need to talk.” you stated through clenched teeth as you pulled him into his room.

summary: Picture this: someone out there, watching the film more than once, made an attempt to contact Steve Rogers’ number just to see...
body:
The secret behind Steve Rogers’ phone number in “Avengers: Infinity War”?

Picture this: someone out there, watching the film more than once, made an attempt to contact Steve Rogers’ number just to see what happens. So his number is listed as (678)-136-7092. According to the Russo Brothers, this was always the intention for Captain America’s number in particular:

“We actually had intended to create a fake voicemail from Steve Rogers. For the people that left the theater and called that number, they would get a voicemail from Steve Rogers,” Joe Russo revealed.

In addition to Joe Russo’s statement, according to Anthony Russo, the number shown was in fact, an actual phone number that they had planned to use. However, the film’s legal department prevented this from being a possibility:

“We had it all ready to go, but legal took that away from us,” Anthony Russo said.

-

It would be really cool tho, can you imagine when you call the number steve would actually say somethings like he did in spiderman hoco “so, you saw this number and expects someone to pick it up?”

source

summary:
So I'm rather fascinated by the sibling dynamic between Thor and Loki. It's SO WELL DONE. 
It's not hard to notice Thor, the...
body:
So I’m rather fascinated by the sibling dynamic between Thor and Loki. It’s SO WELL DONE.

It’s not hard to notice Thor, the elder brother, doing what older siblings typically do – try to keep their younger siblings out of mischief and on the straight and narrow. That’s particularly good in Ragnarok, because Thor finally figured out how to get to Loki, and so it actually produced some results.

But the relationship is mutual; it goes both ways. Thor eventually manages to push Loki in a positive direction, and it’s pretty clear that he consciously tries to do so even when he doesn’t exactly succeed. But what might be less obvious is that Loki, for all his mischief and villainous tendencies, has a pretty consistently positive influence on Thor all the way through.

Thor 1: Maybe Loki does make mischief by letting Frost Giants into Asgard in the middle of Thor’s coronation, but the string of events Loki’s actions cause results in the banishment to earth that makes Thor really grow up and become worthy of his weapon.

Avengers 1: Loki wreaks havoc on earth, but that’s what brings Thor back there and gets him involved with the Avengers.

The Dark World: Of course Thor doesn’t trust Loki anymore in this one, but Loki actually tries to be a decent brother for once (he even protects Jane). Maybe that’s all it takes for Thor to see Loki as potentially redeemable and to figure out how to be the person who can actually get to him in Ragnarok. And Thor even admits to learning a lesson about kingship from him.

Ragnarok: well, the fact that Loki is still always such a trickster results in Thor learning a bit of cunning himself. And it also seems that Thor gains confidence in sticky situations from having Loki around… I think that’s why he manages to use his lightning so spectacularly against Hela without his hammer.

Infinity War: Loki’s death is what finally drives Thor to the breaking point… And to all the awesome character development that comes out of that.

So the younger sibling exerts a positive influence by making mischief and generally being a brat… But a rather lovable and needy one. He’s not in a position to moralize and advise anyway – older siblings have too much of a headstart on life for that to work most of the time (Loki does try to keep Thor from going to Jotunheim in Thor 1… Doesn’t work, of course).

But the fact that Thor feels to some extent responsible for his brother and does care a lot about him, means that Loki’s mischief and general younger-brother brattiness (and repeated deaths) forces Thor to mature more himself, make friends (and learn the value of people) on other worlds, and learn to forgive, to treat as equal, to let go, not to take for granted, and to channel grief into positive action. All the best character development in Thor was pretty much triggered by Loki.

So the younger siblings who seem to be the bane of their older siblings lives… Maybe they do get (justly) reprimanded and corrected for their mischief, but… You can’t really have a hero like Thor without a mischievous, troublemaking, annoying, but loveable Loki for him to keep an eye on and take care of.

The only sad thing is, younger siblings hardly ever get to know how much they’ve contributed to making their elders what they are.

tags: this is a system Im going to use
summary: Laundry Headcanon
body:
Laundry Headcanon

(Ignore me for this stupid fucking headcanon but I like it)

I’ve read these one shots where people seem convinced that the avengers do their laundry themselves and seperatly. Now, one of them specifically was about washing ones fancier underwear, so I guess that makes sense, but I don’t think they do that.

I think that, if they do their laundry themselves at all, they do it in bulk. They have bins for each temperature (somewhat colour sorted) and if it’s not in a hurry to wash you just chuck it in there, but if it is then you chuck it, along with the correlating bin’s content, in the wash and turn it on.

Now, for underwear they gotta have a system. Two females and, what, seven (I count Bucky and Pietro as well so that would be nine) males, all who have a (somewhat) similar taste in underwear. Seven days a week, that’s 49 (63) pairs of boxers and 14 panties an potantially one or two bras.

So either they have their own tiny bins hanging on the wall above the big bins, with their names above and a lil tab of fabric to cover the opening, or my personal favorite and idea:

They first had a system, at least the girls did, where they agreed to only buy one colour of underwear (Nat black, Wanda red). This worked until one of them wanted to wear something white. So the next thing, the system they actually use today and the boys joined in on, is that they put a stitch of colourful thread in the back.

If you can’t find a thread on black underwear it’s Nat’s, because she is black, or she was too lazy to put it there since it’s already black.


So the colours (at least in my head) are:

- Nat is black

- Wanda is red


(- Pietro is light blue)

- Thor is dark blue (too many with blue outfits!)

- Clint is purple

- Banner is green (I would make him purple if I could)

- Tony is gold (…)

- Steve is white (or Thor could be red and Cap dark blue)

(- Bucky I’m going silver on, or grey.)

- Vision is yellow (that works, right?)

- Sam is grey (I had forgotten about him and Vision until I started writing this post. Realising the amounts of fights regarding underwear between him and Bucky so maybe let Bucky be black or something, but this is just how I imagine it).

And the basic rule says ‘if it looks weird (as in not traditional human style) it’s Thor’s’.


Thanks for listening to me rant about underwear for a good five minutes of your time.

So either they have their own tiny bins hanging on the wall above the big bins, with their names above and a lil tab of fabric to cover the opening, or my personal favorite and idea:

They first had a system, at least the girls did, where they agreed to only buy one colour of underwear (Nat black, Wanda red). This worked until one of them wanted to wear something white. So the next thing, the system they actually use today and the boys joined in on, is that they put a stitch of colourful thread in the back.

If you can’t find a thread on black underwear it’s Nat’s, because she is black, or she was too lazy to put it there since it’s already black.


So the colours (at least in my head) are:

- Nat is black

- Wanda is red


(- Pietro is light blue)

- Thor is dark blue (too many with blue outfits!)

- Clint is purple

- Banner is green (I would make him purple if I could)

- Tony is gold (…)

- Steve is white (or Thor could be red and Cap dark blue)

(- Bucky I’m going silver on, or grey.)

- Vision is yellow (that works, right?)

- Sam is grey (I had forgotten about him and Vision until I started writing this post. Realising the amounts of fights regarding underwear between him and Bucky so maybe let Bucky be black or something, but this is just how I imagine it).

And the basic rule says ‘if it looks weird (as in not traditional human style) it’s Thor’s’.


Thanks for listening to me rant about underwear for a good five minutes of your time.

summary: Steve Rogers Angst Alphabet
title: Steve Rogers Angst Alphabet
body:
Author: Cherry🍒
Requested: Anonymous.

A— Abnormal (what makes them different?)

Steve’s appearance has always made him different. He went from being shorter and smaller than everyone else, even smaller than some children. Then he became taller and buffer than most people, while he knows it’s not necessarily a bad thing, he still knows it makes him different.

B— Bad Habits (what bad habits do they have?)

When Steve was younger, he had a bad habit of picking his scabs. After the cuts, from being hit in a fight, would heal up, Steve would peel them off. He doesn’t remember when it started. He thinks that maybe it was because he was angry at himself for not fighting back harder so he would inflict more pain on himself as punishment.

C— Crying (what makes them cry?)

The memories of the friends and family he’s lost in his life. When he thinks of the lives he wasn’t able to save, he breaks a little bit more.

D— Death (How do they die? With family or alone? How does their partner find out?)

Steve dies in battle. He threw himself in front of a team member to save them. He would go out being what he has always been, a hero. His partner would be in the battle with Steve, fighting alongside him when he dies. They would be forced to watch the love of their life die in front of their eyes.

E— Embarrassed (what embarrasses them?)

When Steve thinks back to all the times Bucky had to save him, he feels embarrassed. He hated that someone had to save him, to protect him from himself. He wished he could have been stronger, tougher and not have needed to depend on Bucky as much as he did.

F— Fracture (what was the first bone that broke/fractured and how?)

His wrist was his first broken bone. It happened when he saw a classmate of his being beaten up and he stepped in to defend him. This immediately gained the attention of the attackers who turned their focus on to Steve.

G— Gullible (who are they most gullible to and why?)

Himself. He listens to the negative voice in his head too often and he believes the horrible things it says. “You should have tried harder.” “You’re not good enough.” “Their deaths are your fault.” Steve knows that some things are his fault, that there was nothing he could have done, but he still can’t help but believe the voice and then blames himself.  

H— Heartbreak (how did they deal with their first heartbreak?)

Steve’s first heartbreak was watching the girl he was falling in love with asking Bucky out on a date. He felt his heart being crushed when he heard their conversation. Steve ignored the pain he felt, he pushed it down and decided to move on. He didn’t think there was anything else he could do.

I— Insecure (what are their insecurities?)

At times, Steve still sees himself as the short, frail man from Brooklyn who was constantly looked over by everyone. He knows he doesn’t look the way he used to, but sometimes he still sees himself weak.

J— Jealous (what makes them feel jealous of others?)

Seeing happy families together makes him jealous. He knows he’d never be able to have that. He could never settle down, build a home, have children, and grow old with the love of his life. Steve sometimes wishes that he could retire from being Captain America and have a simple life, but he knows he could never do that.

K— Knife (how do they feel about hurting others?)

It doesn’t really bother him, people being hurt or getting killed is just a part of life and war. Steve knows it’s necessary, especially on missions when there are evil men with malicious intents that need to be stopped. But he hates it when innocent people get hurt, whether it’s directly because of him or because of someone he was meant to stop.

L— Love (who was their first love? Was it returned? How did it end?)

Peggy was the first love of his life. The way he felt when she was around him or when he thought of her, was a feeling he’d never felt before, and one he thought he’d never feel again.

M— Mindfulness (what calms them down when they’re feeling anxious or depressed?)

When Steve is feeling dejected, he’ll go for a long run or workout to exhaust himself. When he pushes himself to the brink of physical exhaustion he finds that it distracts him from his bad thoughts, he becomes too tired to think of anything negative.

N— Nightmare (do they have them? How often? What’s their reaction, and what are they about?)

Nightmares used to make an appearance every time he closed his eyes, but over time they faded away. Steve will have a nightmare every now and then, especially after a bad mission or if something happened to make him suddenly remember a bad event from the past. When Steve has them, he tries to brush them off and ignore them even though they tend to keep replaying in his mind for the next day or two.

O— Obsess (what they’re obsessed with that other people judge them for? What’s their “weird” obsession?)

Steve is obsessed with psychology. He likes to know how peoples minds work, why they behave the way they do. He finds it incredibly interesting and he believes it helps him while he’s on missions, having an insight on how the enemy mind might be working. Steve has a collection of psychology books and documentary DVDs in his room.

P— Pet (how do they react when their first pet dies?)

It shattered his heart. Other than Bucky, his first dog was his best friend. He spent a lot of his time with the dog, he always talked to the dog about his problems and how his day was. When he lost his first pet, he felt lonely.

Q— Quirks (what’s one of their quirks they consider a flaw that everyone else likes?)

The left side of Steve’s lips pull up into a half smile when he’s listening to someone speak and he’s wholeheartedly enjoying the conversation. Steve thinks it’s odd that he does that, he never realised he did it until someone pointed it out. But everyone else loves that he does it, it lets them know when he’s genuinely liking a conversation and it also brightens up his handsome features.

R— Repressed (what memories do they repress or they wish they could forget?)

Steve wishes he could forget seeing Bucky fall from the train. The helplessness and feelings of incapability still linger with him. The look on Bucky’s face as he fell was burned into Steves mind.

S— School (were they ever bullied? What made them personally dislike the school system?)

Steve was constantly bullied while he was at school, and out of school too.  Bullies always took a special notice of Steve because of how different he was. He was small, thin and not usually around too many friends. Bullies saw him as an easy victim.

T— Television (what show or movie always makes them cry?)

Anything about war, whether it’s the past or present. When he sees movies or anything to do with war, it makes him think of the past, the things he had to do, the people that he lost and it tears him apart inside.

U— Umbrage (what pisses them off? What offends them?)

When he hears of injustices or anything unfair, he gets pissed off. He hates when people aren’t treated equally, fairly or justly. Steve believes in equality, and he’ll always fight for what’s right.

V— Venturesome (what risks do they take that they shouldn’t?)

When he’s on missions, Steve will do anything to protect innocent people and make sure the mission is completed successfully, a lot of these things are dangerous and could kill him. Steve realises that he’s taking huge risks but in his mind, it doesn’t matter as long as no uninvolved people get hurt.

W— Weakness (what is their personal weakness?)

His friends and family. There is nothing he wouldn’t do for them, he would give his own life for them a thousand times. Everyone, especially his enemies, realises this and they’ll try to use it to their advantage. Steve surround himself with his friends and family, and he relies on them a lot. Losing them would devastate him.

X— X-Double-Minus (random sad headcanon)

Steve remembers most of the names of the innocent people that were lost because of him. He has their names jotted down in a small notebook that he carries around with him everywhere. It reminds him to keep trying harder, to keep fighting the good fight. It’s also motivation to not let any more names end up in the little notebook.

Y— Yearn (what is one thing they want that they know they can’t have?)

Normalcy. He wants to be able to have a normal life, do ordinary things that other normal people do. Steve knows he would never be able to leave his job, he just doesn’t have it in him to give it up. His desire to keep fighting overrules his desire to settle down with someone and have an ordinary, day-to-day life.

Z— Zoophobia (is there any animal/bug/creature that scares them?)

Steve hates spiders. The eerie little (sometimes not so little) creatures creep him out and always have. He got bit by one when he was younger and ever since he can’t stand them, Steve will refuse to even be in the same room as one.

F— Fracture (what was the first bone that broke/fractured and how?)

His wrist was his first broken bone. It happened when he saw a classmate of his being beaten up and he stepped in to defend him. This immediately gained the attention of the attackers who turned their focus on to Steve.

G— Gullible (who are they most gullible to and why?)

Himself. He listens to the negative voice in his head too often and he believes the horrible things it says. “You should have tried harder.” “You’re not good enough.” “Their deaths are your fault.” Steve knows that some things are his fault, that there was nothing he could have done, but he still can’t help but believe the voice and then blames himself.  

H— Heartbreak (how did they deal with their first heartbreak?)

Steve’s first heartbreak was watching the girl he was falling in love with asking Bucky out on a date. He felt his heart being crushed when he heard their conversation. Steve ignored the pain he felt, he pushed it down and decided to move on. He didn’t think there was anything else he could do.

I— Insecure (what are their insecurities?)

At times, Steve still sees himself as the short, frail man from Brooklyn who was constantly looked over by everyone. He knows he doesn’t look the way he used to, but sometimes he still sees himself weak.

J— Jealous (what makes them feel jealous of others?)

Seeing happy families together makes him jealous. He knows he’d never be able to have that. He could never settle down, build a home, have children, and grow old with the love of his life. Steve sometimes wishes that he could retire from being Captain America and have a simple life, but he knows he could never do that.

K— Knife (how do they feel about hurting others?)

It doesn’t really bother him, people being hurt or getting killed is just a part of life and war. Steve knows it’s necessary, especially on missions when there are evil men with malicious intents that need to be stopped. But he hates it when innocent people get hurt, whether it’s directly because of him or because of someone he was meant to stop.

L— Love (who was their first love? Was it returned? How did it end?)

Peggy was the first love of his life. The way he felt when she was around him or when he thought of her, was a feeling he’d never felt before, and one he thought he’d never feel again.

M— Mindfulness (what calms them down when they’re feeling anxious or depressed?)

When Steve is feeling dejected, he’ll go for a long run or workout to exhaust himself. When he pushes himself to the brink of physical exhaustion he finds that it distracts him from his bad thoughts, he becomes too tired to think of anything negative.

N— Nightmare (do they have them? How often? What’s their reaction, and what are they about?)

Nightmares used to make an appearance every time he closed his eyes, but over time they faded away. Steve will have a nightmare every now and then, especially after a bad mission or if something happened to make him suddenly remember a bad event from the past. When Steve has them, he tries to brush them off and ignore them even though they tend to keep replaying in his mind for the next day or two.

O— Obsess (what they’re obsessed with that other people judge them for? What’s their “weird” obsession?)

Steve is obsessed with psychology. He likes to know how peoples minds work, why they behave the way they do. He finds it incredibly interesting and he believes it helps him while he’s on missions, having an insight on how the enemy mind might be working. Steve has a collection of psychology books and documentary DVDs in his room.

P— Pet (how do they react when their first pet dies?)

It shattered his heart. Other than Bucky, his first dog was his best friend. He spent a lot of his time with the dog, he always talked to the dog about his problems and how his day was. When he lost his first pet, he felt lonely.

Q— Quirks (what’s one of their quirks they consider a flaw that everyone else likes?)

The left side of Steve’s lips pull up into a half smile when he’s listening to someone speak and he’s wholeheartedly enjoying the conversation. Steve thinks it’s odd that he does that, he never realised he did it until someone pointed it out. But everyone else loves that he does it, it lets them know when he’s genuinely liking a conversation and it also brightens up his handsome features.

R— Repressed (what memories do they repress or they wish they could forget?)

Steve wishes he could forget seeing Bucky fall from the train. The helplessness and feelings of incapability still linger with him. The look on Bucky’s face as he fell was burned into Steves mind.

S— School (were they ever bullied? What made them personally dislike the school system?)

Steve was constantly bullied while he was at school, and out of school too.  Bullies always took a special notice of Steve because of how different he was. He was small, thin and not usually around too many friends. Bullies saw him as an easy victim.

T— Television (what show or movie always makes them cry?)

Anything about war, whether it’s the past or present. When he sees movies or anything to do with war, it makes him think of the past, the things he had to do, the people that he lost and it tears him apart inside.

U— Umbrage (what pisses them off? What offends them?)

When he hears of injustices or anything unfair, he gets pissed off. He hates when people aren’t treated equally, fairly or justly. Steve believes in equality, and he’ll always fight for what’s right.

V— Venturesome (what risks do they take that they shouldn’t?)

When he’s on missions, Steve will do anything to protect innocent people and make sure the mission is completed successfully, a lot of these things are dangerous and could kill him. Steve realises that he’s taking huge risks but in his mind, it doesn’t matter as long as no uninvolved people get hurt.

W— Weakness (what is their personal weakness?)

His friends and family. There is nothing he wouldn’t do for them, he would give his own life for them a thousand times. Everyone, especially his enemies, realises this and they’ll try to use it to their advantage. Steve surround himself with his friends and family, and he relies on them a lot. Losing them would devastate him.

X— X-Double-Minus (random sad headcanon)

Steve remembers most of the names of the innocent people that were lost because of him. He has their names jotted down in a small notebook that he carries around with him everywhere. It reminds him to keep trying harder, to keep fighting the good fight. It’s also motivation to not let any more names end up in the little notebook.

Y— Yearn (what is one thing they want that they know they can’t have?)

Normalcy. He wants to be able to have a normal life, do ordinary things that other normal people do. Steve knows he would never be able to leave his job, he just doesn’t have it in him to give it up. His desire to keep fighting overrules his desire to settle down with someone and have an ordinary, day-to-day life.

Z— Zoophobia (is there any animal/bug/creature that scares them?)

Steve hates spiders. The eerie little (sometimes not so little) creatures creep him out and always have. He got bit by one when he was younger and ever since he can’t stand them, Steve will refuse to even be in the same room as one.
trail.content_abstract:
Author: Cherry🍒
Requested: Anonymous.

A— Abnormal (what makes them different?)

Steve’s appearance has always made him different. He went from being shorter and smaller than everyone else, even smaller than some children. Then he became taller and buffer than most people, while he knows it’s not necessarily a bad thing, he still knows it makes him different.

B— Bad Habits (what bad habits do they have?)

When Steve was younger, he had a bad habit of picking his scabs. After the cuts, from being hit in a fight, would heal up, Steve would peel them off. He doesn’t remember when it started. He thinks that maybe it was because he was angry at himself for not fighting back harder so he would inflict more pain on himself as punishment.
